intro: Cylicodaphne akoensis, commonly known as the Akoense sago palm, is a species native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly Cameroon. It is a member of the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by the development of hard, fibrous fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and potential economic uses in its native habitat.
